title: Ticket #4162: Configure GPU resources by default
description:
HTCondor should detect GPUs automatically and configure them to be used as resources when appropriate CUDA (and/or OpenCL?) libraries are detected.

Alternate possibility, 1 config knob can be set to enable use of GPU resources with default settings.

Questions to be answered:

  • What will GPU resources will be called? possibilities are GPU, GPUs, CUDA

  • What GPU attributes should be published into the STARTD Ad by default

  • Should any of the default attributes be updated periodically, like temperature?

  • What knobs are available to customize and enhance GPU support.

  • It is needed to support more than one API (CUDA, OpenCL) on a single execute node.

    • multiple versions of the same api?

  • Is it needed to be able to support more than one type of GPU on a single execute node. i.e. some GeForce GPUs and some Tesla GPUs on the same node.

  • Does matchmaking need to distinguish GPU types

    • Should we even call them GPU resources, perhaps CUDA type or TESLA type? so the user would request_cuda=1 or request_tesla=1 instead of request_gpu=1
